author: maxfunke
body:
The chechsum for v6.2.0 for alpine is not the same as expected. Therefore I guess my following command fails (after downloading of course):

```bash
tar zvxf /tmp/ps.tar.gz -C $MY_PS_INSTALL_FOLDER
gzip: invalid magic
tar: Child returned status 1
tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now
```

# Steps to reproduce

download tar.gz for 
```bash
curl https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.2.0/powershell-6.2.0-linux-alpine-x64.tar.gz --output /tmp/ps.tar.gz

sha256sum /tmp/ps.tar.gz
```

# Expected behavior

returns same checksum as listed in release v6.2.0
```none
A44243CA24AF415F7393C53BE6BF3E7A5B546B79C9F3F870F9A974CAFE8831E6  /tmp/ps.tar.gz
```

# Actual behavior

returns different checksum
```none
189a52e839f598b15c3c024e61b231e53de234fd5bb43ffdbffe0b1262a8eece  /tmp/ps.tar.gz
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
curl 7.58.0
tar 1.29
sha256sum 8.28
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I downloaded the file and opened without problem. It seems you have cached broken file.

comments.author: maxfunke
comments.body: Cache maybe was a problem. Thanks

title: checksum seems to be wrong
